articles.summary: Ghana is set to introduce a blockchain-based gold tracking system as part of efforts to overhaul the sector and combat illegal exports. articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: Ripple has launched a strategic partnership with Chipper Cash to expand the use of Ripple-powered payment services across Africa. articles.title: US DOJ says it seized Hamas crypto meant to finance terrorism
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: The US Justice Department seized more than $200,000 in cryptocurrency intended to benefit the militant group Hamas. The cryptocurrency with a total value of $201,400 was traced to fundraising addresses, it said in a statement on March 27. It said the money was intended to be donated to Hamas.

articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has announced the seizure of approximately $200,000 in cryptocurrency. This crypto seizure targeted a digital wallet allegedly linked to Hamas, the Palestinian militant group. The seizure highlights the ongoing battle against illicit finance in the digital age.

articles.title: Romania Cracks Down on Crypto Laundering Scheme
articles.author: Zdravko Ljubas
articles.summary: Romanian authorities conducted 66 searches across the country on Wednesday, detaining 15 suspects linked to an organized crime group accused of embezzlement, misuse of company assets, and money laundering. Among those detained were legal representatives of several companies. The group allegedly misappropriated more than 25,000 cryptocurrency units, valued at over $14.3 million from an energy project between 2018 and 2020.
